subject: Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race (Alaska)
Dog Sledding
lead_paragraph: The former champion Mitch Seavey took the lead at the Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race, becoming the first musher to reach the ghost town of Ophir, Alaska. Seavey, the winner of the 2004 race, overtook the earlier leaders, including the defending champion, Lance Mackey, who was first to the Takotna checkpoint. Seavey covered the 25 miles to Ophir — 444 miles into the 1,100-mile race — in just under three hours.
